CatDescriptText: Edna Thomas, hospital worker, 4046-1/2 Windgap Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 7, 1959, pg. 29 with question: "Do you think that the Wacs and others women's units, with the exception of nurses, should be abolished in armed services during peacetime? Why?" answer reads: "I think that the parents rule.  And, in my opinion, the mothers and fathers should not let the children take advantage of them.  The best way of correction is not to whip the children but rather to take away certain of their advantages."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Edna Thomas wearing light colored coat with shawl collar and covered buttons, carrying handbag, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, with May Building with Thrift Drugs, and Kappels stores in background, corner of Liberty Avenue and Fifth Avenue, Downtown
